DERBY-5284 A derby crash at exactly right time during a btree split can cause a corrupt db which can not be booted.
backport fix from trunk to 10.8 branch.
Fixed a problem during BTREE split. The first phase of btree split sees if it can reclaim space from committed deleted rows. If it finds any it purges these rows in a nested internal transaction. It needs to hold the latch on the page until end of transaction, but did not. This allowed a very small window of a few instructions where another insert could use the space on the page and then a system crash could cause the purges to undo but fail due to the insert.
The fix was to hold the latch and let commit release it.
